result.execSummary:
The defendant Christopher J Pierce was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse, Domestic Abuse Assessments], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).
  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: If probation becomes revoked, the defendant is to receive 83 days sentence credit.

miscConds.notes:
1.  Defendant is to undergo, participate in and successfully complete alcohol and drug abuse assessment and comply with any follow-up counseling as recommended.
2.  Defendant is to undergo, participate in and successfully complete a Domestic Abuse Assessment and comply with any follow-up counseling as recommended.
3.  No Contact with the victim.  Forms of no contact include: in person, in writing, by telephone, by e-mail, or by any other forms of electronic communication, or through a third party intending to circumvent the no contact provision.
4.  Defendant is to maintain absolute sobriety - not to possess or consume any alcohol, illegal drugs or prescription drugs without a valid prescription.
5.  Defendant is to abide by all rules and recommendations of the supervising agent.

ADDRESS INFO for Christopher J Pierce

11:08 a.m.  Defendant present in custody and with Atty Barbara Privat on 2014CF42 & 2014CF52 and Atty Chadwick Kaehne via telephone on 2014CT25, 2014CM21 & 2014CF26.  Andrew Christenson for the State of Wisconsin.  Atty Kaehne will be scheduling a suppression motion and is to schedule in approx 30 days with the Judicial Assistant.  Atty Privat recites plea agreement, defendant will plea to count 1 & 4 on 2014CF52 and counts 2 on 2014CF42 and the balance of the counts will be dismissed and read-in.  DA concurs.  Defendant concurs.  Atty Privat questions the court in regards to 83 days of sentence credit.  Statement by the Court, if sentences are concurrent, sentence credit would apply to both cases.  Court goes over plea questionnaire with the defendant.  Court goes over constitutional rights with the defendant - defendant waives these rights.  Court goes over the elements of each offense.  Court instructs defendant of the maximum penalty.  Court instructs defendant regarding deportation.  Defendant enters a plea of NO CONTEST to count 1 &4 on 2014CF52 as charged and count 2 on 2014CF42 as charged.  Court finds the plea is made freely, voluntarily, intelligently and understandingly.  Court finds there is a factual basis to support the plea.  Court finds the defendant guilty on counts 1 & 4 on 2014CF52 & count 2 on 2014CF42.  Court orders the balance of the counts be dismissed and read-in.  Court orders the judgment of conviction be entered here today.  DA confirms compliance with victim witness rights.  Sentencing statement by DA.  Sentencing statement by Atty Privat.  No statement by defendant.

Court sentences the defendant to:  

COUNT 1 - Sentence Withheld and places the defendant on probation for 18 months.

CONDITIONS:
-  Defendant is to undergo, participate in and successfully complete alcohol and drug abuse assessment and comply with any follow-up counseling as recommended.
-  Defendant is to undergo, participate in and successfully complete a Domestic Abuse Assessment and comply with any follow-up counseling as recommended.
-  No Contact with the victim.  Forms of no contact include: in person, in writing, by telephone, by e-mail, or by any other forms of electronic communication, or through a third party intending to circumvent the no contact provision.
-  Defendant is to maintain absolute sobriety - not to possess or consume any alcohol, illegal drugs or prescription drugs without a valid prescription.
-  Defendant is to abide by all rules and recommendations of the supervising agent.
-  Court costs

Court grants the defendant 83 days of sentence credit if probation becomes revoked.

Count 2 & 4 (EACH) Court sentences the defendant to 83 days county jail on each count, concurrent to each other.  Court grants the defendant sentence credit of 83 days on each county for a Time Served sentence.  Court costs.

Court adjourned at 11:25  a.m..
Status hearing on August 19, 2014 at 11:00 am.
dated July 10, 2014 to Hon. Mark T. Slate from Attorney Chadwick J. Kaehne
State's
Status hearing on July 14, 2014 at 01:00 pm.
Attorney Barbara Privat
Defendant's Discovery Demand
Defendant's Motion for Discovery
Status hearing on July 21, 2014 at 01:30 pm.

1:32 p.m.  State by Special Prosecutor Chuck Stertz.  Attorney Chadwick Kaehne present on behalf of the defendant on 2014CT25, 2014CM21, and 2014CF26.  Attorney Barbara Privat present on behalf of the defendant on 2014CF42.  No appearance by the defendant.

Court states 2014CF52 is also pending.

Court directs all cases track together.  Court directs preliminary hearings be scheduled on 2014CF42 and 2014CF26 and 2014CF52 (if has not yet been addressed).  All are to be set for the same date/time.

Court adjourned at 1:35 p.m.

2:05 p.m.  State by Special Prosecutor Peter Hahn.  Defendant present, in custody, with Attorney Barbara Privat.

Attorney Privat believes she will be appointed to represent the defendant on this case only.  Attorney Privat indicates the defendant will be waiving his right to a preliminary hearing.  Court instructs defendant of his right to a preliminary hearing.  Defendant waives this right - Court accepts the waiver and binds the defendant over for trial.  

Attorney Hahn provides a copy of the Information to Attorney Privat.  Attorney Privat confirms receipt of the Information - waives reading.  Court makes statement regarding the maximum penalties.  Attorney Privat enters a plea of NOT GUILTY on behalf of the defendant.

Court directs Status Hearing to be held in approximately thirty days.  

Attorney Privat makes statement regarding bond - requests a change in bond.  Argument by Attorney Hahn.  Court denies the request for bond modification.

Court adjourned at 2:11 p.m.
Preliminary hearing on June 17, 2014 at 01:00 pm.
Status hearing on June 16, 2014 at 02:00 pm.

9:03 a.m.  Defendant present in court and in custody without counsel.  Kyle Sargent for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant confirms receipt of the criminal complaint and waives reading.  Court instructs the defendant of the maximum penalty on each count.  Court finds probable cause.  Court instructs the defendant of his right to an attorney.  Defendant enters a plea of NOT GUILTY.  Statement by DA.  Statement by Defendant to reduce Bond.  Request denied by the Court.  Court questions regarding waiver of prelimimary hearing.   Court considers Defendant's reponsse a non-waiver of time limits.  Status hearing will be set for the afternoon of June 16, 2014, notices will be sent.  Preliminary hearing to be set for next Tuesday at 1:00 p.m. 

Court adjourned at 9:07 a.m.
